sections.title: Who I Am
sections.content: I am a 21 year old Informatics student at NTNU, and I'm in the 3rd and final year of my bachelor's degree, but I do plan on taking a followup master's degree. I am a member of the Academic Courses Comittee at the Student Organization Online, where I am the deputy head for the school year 24/25.

sections.title: My Skills
sections.content: I have experience with most modern web development technologies, both frontend and backend. I have also worked with Java for a couple of different projects. I'm a quick learner and always open to learning more!

sections.title: My Journey
sections.content: I started my journey in informatics in 2020, when I took some introductory programming classes in high school. After that, I started my Bachelor of Informatics at NTNU Trondheim and have since then learned a lot about programming, web development, and software engineering. I have worked on several projects, both alone and in groups, and have gained a lot of experience in the field through my summer internship in 2024.

sections.title: My Goals
sections.content: My goal is to become a developer. I want to work on projects that make a difference, and that can help people in their everyday lives. I am passionate about technology, and I am always looking for new challenges and opportunities to learn and grow.

projects.title: Website built with React, TypeScript, Next.js, and Tailwind CSS
projects.description: This project is actually this website! It was built with React, TypeScript, Next.js, and Tailwind CSS. I built it to showcase my work and to provide information about myself to potential employers and collaborators.

projects.title: Quizlet clone with React, TypeScript, Next.js, and Mantine
projects.description: This project was built in a team in the course TDT4140 Software Engineering. It is a clone of the popular flashcard app Quizlet, and was built with React, TypeScript, Next.js, and Mantine. The app allows users to create, share, and study flashcards, and includes features like a quiz mode, a search function, and a dark mode.

projects.title: Hotel Booking app with Java, JavaFX, Maven, and Springboot
projects.description: This app was built in a team in the course IT1901 Informatics Project I. It is a hotel booking app that allows users to search for and book hotel rooms. The app was built with Java, JavaFX, Maven, and Springboot, and includes features like a search function, a booking system, and a user 'database' (even if that database was just a couple JSON filesðŸ«£). This was built very early on in both mine and my team's careers. It was a great learning experience, and I gained a lot of valuable experience in software engineering, teamwork, and project management.
